editions.description: Kristian Garza's technology radar edition showcasing the current state of technologies and practices.

blips.name: Next.js
blips.description: Next.js is a React framework for building full-stack web applications with excellent performance and developer experience.

blips.name: TypeScript
blips.description: TypeScript adds static typing to JavaScript, improving code quality and developer productivity.

blips.name: Tailwind CSS
blips.description: A utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom user interfaces.

blips.name: Chart.js
blips.description: Simple yet flexible JavaScript charting library for designers and developers.

blips.name: React 19
blips.description: The latest major version of React with new features like Server Components and improved hooks.

blips.name: Vite
blips.description: Next generation frontend tooling with fast build times and excellent developer experience.

blips.name: pnpm
blips.description: Fast, disk space efficient package manager for Node.js.

blips.name: Vercel
blips.description: Platform for frontend frameworks and static sites, built to integrate with headless CMS, databases, and more.

blips.name: GitHub Actions
blips.description: Automate, customize, and execute software development workflows right in your repository.

blips.name: Static Site Generation
blips.description: Pre-rendering pages at build time for better performance and SEO.

blips.name: Component-Driven Development
blips.description: Building UIs from the bottom up starting with components and ending with pages.

blips.name: Design Systems
blips.description: A collection of reusable components, guided by clear standards, that can be assembled together to build any number of applications.

blips.name: Turborepo
blips.description: High-performance build system for JavaScript and TypeScript monorepos.

blips.name: Bun
blips.description: All-in-one JavaScript runtime and toolkit designed for speed.

blips.name: Web Components
blips.description: Suite of different technologies allowing you to create reusable custom elements.

blips.name: jQuery
blips.description: Legacy JavaScript library. Modern alternatives are recommended for new projects.
